prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Me. What more can I say? This is my third year as a young (but skilled!) lawyer.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Head of planning, promotion, and security of the Treasures of Kurain Exhibit.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Mask DeMasque
Description: A flashy thief who steals valuable works of art. Sends a calling card before a heist.
Character 7
Name: Luke Atmey
Description: An Ace Detective. Has great powers of deduction, yet rarely makes sense.
Character 8
Name: Ron DeLite
Description: A young man who turned himself in as Mask DeMasque. A bit of a pitiful guy.
Character 9
Name: Desiree DeLite
Description: Ron DeLite's wife. Seems to be a very friendly and out-going lady.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: My friend. I've known this trouble magnet ever since grade school.
Character 11
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 12
Name: Kane Bullard
Description: CEO of KB Security. His body was found inside his safe.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
Evidence 2
Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime. Carried into the basement warehouse the day of the crime. Moved again that night.
Evidence 4
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value. Found in the office of Luke Atmey. Has pink splotches all over it. Found in Atmey's Office. Covered in pink splotches, but it's the genuine article. Broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box. Kept out of sight.
Evidence 5
Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. [info] 

To the Security at Lordly Tailor.

I will be coming to purloin the most
priceless work of art on display in
your "Treasures of Kurain" exhibit.

Take good care of the speckled urn, won't you...?

Yours truly,
Mask DeMasque
Evidence 6
Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.
Evidence 9
Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.
Evidence 10
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. [info] 

Blackmail Letter

If you don't want your true
identity revealed to the world,
come to KB security at 1:00 AM
on October 12th and bring
$50,000.

If you don't, I'll take that red diamond you received the other day instead. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.
Evidence 11
Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).
Evidence 12
Name: Key Card → CEO Office Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used. Found in Ron's wallet. Used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM.
Evidence 13
Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.
Evidence 15
Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.
Evidence 16
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask DeMasque's first heist. [caption] The article is titled 'Stolen!? The Gem and the Thief.' An image of a blue jewel is shown. Mask DeMasque is standing and ruminating in an alley, back to the wall. Next to him is a guiard with a flashlight. There are some trash bags. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.
Evidence 18
Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.
Evidence 20
Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.
Evidence 21
Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.
Evidence 22
Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I first received the request from Lordly Tailor about 20 days ago.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 1
Testimony: The urn was placed in a box, and Zvarri! It was then sent to the warehouse.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 2
Testimony: Hence, I was actually unable to see the urn for myself until the day of the crime...
Person: Atmey
Testimony 3
Testimony: I knew it was an extremely valuable treasure, so I sent my card 10 days beforehand.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 4
Testimony: I then handled security by myself to ensure that my crime would go smoothly!
Person: Atmey
Testimony 5
Testimony: At last, I held the urn in my hands for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th.
Person: Atmey

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find a contradiction between one of the pieces of evidence and one of the testimonies. Let's start by going through each testimony and cross-referencing with the evidence.

Testimony 0: Atmey says he received the request from Lordly Tailor 20 days ago. Not sure which evidence relates to that. The Exhibit Poster (2) might mention the exhibit details, but not sure if there's a contradiction here.

Testimony 1: Atmey claims the urn was placed in a box and sent to the warehouse. Evidence 4 is the Sacred Urn, which mentions it was found in Atmey's office with pink splotches. Wait, but according to this testimony, the urn was sent to the warehouse. But the evidence says it was found in Atmey's office. That seems conflicting. Because if he sent it to the warehouse, how did it end up in his office?

Wait, but let's check the exact details. Evidence 4 says the Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office, covered in pink splotches. And Testimony 1 says the urn was sent to the warehouse. So there's a contradiction here. If the urn was supposed to be in the warehouse, but it's actually in Atmey's office, then Atmey's testimony that he sent it to the warehouse is a lie. That's a possible contradiction between Testimony 1 and Evidence 4.

Wait, but maybe there's more. Let's look at other testimonies. Testimony 2: Atmey says he couldn't see the urn until the day of the crime. But if the urn was in his office (as per Evidence 4), then he would have seen it before the crime. That could be another contradiction. So Testimony 2 (which is testimony index 2) and Evidence 4. Let me check that.

Testimony 2: "Hence, I was actually unable to see the urn for myself until the day of the crime..." But Evidence 4 states the urn was found in Atmey's office. If he couldn't see it until the day of the crime, but the urn was in his office, then unless he obtained it on the day of the crime, that would contradict. But how did it get there? The urn was moved again that night. Wait, the Sacred Urn was broken and repaired by Adrian two weeks ago, then replaced in its box. The box (Evidence 21) has pink stains. So the urn was supposed to be in the warehouse, but was moved to Atmey's office. If Atmey claims he couldn't see it until the day of the crime, but it was in his office (which he would have access to), that's a contradiction. So Testimony 2 (index 2) and Evidence 4.

Alternatively, Testimony 5: Atmey says he held the urn for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th. But the urn was in his office, so if he had access to his office before that, he could have held it earlier. But the Sacred Urn was found in his office, which implies he had it there, so Testimony 5 would be a lie. But perhaps the timing is tricky here. Let's check the timeline.

The crime's time of death was 1 AM. The camera data (7) shows the warehouse camera went off around 1 AM. The Sacred Urn was in Atmey's office. If Atmey held the urn at 1 AM, but the urn was already in his office, maybe that's conflicting. But I'm getting a bit confused here.

Wait, let's re-examine the evidence. Evidence 4 says the urn was found in Atmey's office, covered in pink splotches, and it was broken and repaired by Adrian two weeks ago, then replaced in its box. The box (Evidence 21) has pink paint stains. So after being repaired, Adrian put it back in the box, but kept it out of sight. But according to Testimony 1, Atmey claims he sent the urn to the warehouse. However, the urn ended up in his office. So if he sent it to the warehouse, how did it end up in his office? That's a contradiction between Testimony 1 (index 1) and Evidence 4. But wait, maybe the urn was moved again. The Golden Statue (Evidence 3) was moved into the basement warehouse the day of the crime, then moved again that night. But the Sacred Urn's movements are different.

Alternatively, Testimony 3: Atmey says he knew the urn was extremely valuable, so he sent his card 10 days beforehand. But Evidence 5 is the calling card, which mentions the "speckled urn". However, the Sacred Urn (Evidence 4) is described as having pink splotches. So if the calling card refers to the "speckled urn" but the actual urn has pink splotches, that could be a discrepancy. But the Sacred Urn's description in Evidence 4 says "pink splotches all over it" and "speckled" might be the same as splotched. But maybe not. Alternatively, if the urn in the exhibit was supposed to be the Sacred Urn, but the calling card refers to it as speckled, but the real urn has pink splotches, that might not match. Wait, but the Sacred Urn's box (Evidence 21) has pink paint stains from when Adrian dropped it, which matches the urn's splotches. So maybe the "speckled urn" in the calling card is referring to the Sacred Urn. But the calling card is sent by Mask DeMasque (Evidence 5), which is supposedly Atmey's alter ego? Or is it Ron? Wait, the case involves Ron being accused as Mask DeMasque. But maybe Atmey is the real culprit. 

Alternatively, if Atmey sent the calling card (Testimony 3) referring to the Sacred Urn as "speckled", but the actual urn has pink splotches, then that's a contradiction. Because the calling card mentions the "speckled urn", but the actual urn is pink-splotched, which might not be speckled. However, maybe "speckled" is a synonym here, but that's a stretch. Alternatively, the Sacred Urn was supposed to be in the warehouse, but Atmey's testimony (Testimony 1) says he sent it there, but the urn is found in his office (Evidence 4), which contradicts his statement. Therefore, Testimony 1 (index 1) and Evidence 4. 

Another angle: Testimony 5 says Atmey held the urn at 1 AM on 10/12. But the urn was in his office. How did he get it? If the urn was supposed to be in the warehouse, then he couldn't have held it unless he moved it. But if he was in his office, then maybe that's possible. Alternatively, the Sacred Urn was moved to the warehouse, but then taken to his office. But according to the evidence, the Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office. So if he sent it to the warehouse (Testimony 1), but it's in his office, then there's a contradiction. Therefore, Testimony 1 (index 1) and Evidence 4 (urn in his office) contradict each other. 

Alternatively, Testimony 2 says he couldn't see the urn until the day of the crime. But if the urn was in his office, he could have seen it earlier. So that would contradict Testimony 2 (index 2) and Evidence 4. But when was the urn moved to his office? The Sacred Urn was replaced in its box by Adrian two weeks ago, then kept out of sight. So perhaps it was in storage until moved to the warehouse. But according to Testimony 1, Atmey sent it to the warehouse. But if it was found in his office, that's a contradiction. 

Wait, the Sacred Urn's evidence says it was found in Atmey's office. If Atmey claims he sent it to the warehouse (Testimony 1), but it's in his office, then that's a contradiction. So the correct pair would be Evidence 4 and Testimony 1. But let me check the indexes. Evidence 4 is the Sacred Urn. Testimony 1 is Atmey's statement about sending the urn to the warehouse. So the contradiction is that he claims to have sent it to the warehouse, but the urn was in his office. Therefore, the answer is {"evidence": 4, "testimony": 1}.
